intro: Onosma lhokaensis, commonly known as the Lhoka sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Tibet. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with woolly, silver-green foliage. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh, high-altitude environments of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
